c:
2 \cdot (x - 2 y) + (- 2 x + 4 y) = 2 \cdot 3 + \alpha \Leftrightarrow 2 x - 4 y - 2 x + 4 y = 6 + \alpha
\Leftrightarrow 0 = 6 + \alpha \, .

\begin{aligned}
x + y + \alpha z & = & 1 \,, \\ x + \alpha y + z & = & 1 \,, \\ \alpha x + y + z & = & 1\end{aligned}

\begin{array}{rclcrclcl} (1 - y - \alpha z) + \alpha y + z & = & 1 & \Leftrightarrow &
-(1 - \alpha) y + (1 - \alpha) z & = & 0 & & : \ \mbox{Gleichung}\  (2') \,, \\
\alpha (1 - y - \alpha z) + y + z & = & 1 & \Leftrightarrow &
(1 - \alpha) y + (1 - \alpha^2) z & = & 1 - \alpha & & : \ \mbox{Gleichung}\  (3') \, . \end{array}
{ L} = \{ (s\coordsep t\coordsep 1 - s- t)  {\,}:{\,}  s, t \in \mathbb{R} \} \, .

\begin{array}{rcll}
      x -y +t z&=& t &
      \mbox{Gl.}\  (1)\,, \\[0.5ex]
      t x + (1-t)y +(1+t^2)z&=& -1+t &
      \mbox{Gl.}\  (2)\,, \\[0.5ex]
      x-y+t z&=& -1+t+t^2 &
      \mbox{Gl.}\  (3') \, .
  \end{array}
